description: View priority factors for jobs in the Slurm queue. Shows how job priority is calculated from multiple factors including age, fair-share, job size, partition, and QOS. Essential for understanding why jobs are scheduled in a particular order.

installation.notes: Part of Slurm workload manager client utilities.

global_options.description: Show priority for specific job IDs
Show the priority weights for each factor

common_usage_patterns.description: Show priority factors for all pending jobs
common_usage_patterns.output_example:
JOBID PARTITION     USER   PRIORITY       SITE        AGE  FAIRSHARE    JOBSIZE  PARTITION        QOS        NICE
  12345     gpu     user1       1234          0        100        500        100        500         34          0
  12346     gpu     user2       1156          0         80        450        100        500         26          0

common_usage_patterns.description: Show detailed priority with long format

common_usage_patterns.output_example:
JOBID PARTITION     USER   PRIORITY       SITE        AGE  FAIRSHARE    JOBSIZE  PARTITION        QOS        NICE
Weights                                        1       1000       5000        500       1000       2000

error_messages.message: slurm_load_job error: Invalid job id specified

interoperability.notes: sprio shows how multifactor priority is computed. Components include: AGE (how long in queue), FAIRSHARE (user/account historical usage), JOBSIZE (resource requests), PARTITION (partition priority), QOS (quality of service), NICE (user adjustment). Higher total PRIORITY means earlier scheduling.

permissions.notes: All users can view priority information

limitations: Only works with multifactor priority plugin
Priority changes dynamically as jobs age
Does not predict actual start time (use squeue --start)
Fair-share calculations depend on accounting data

reads_from.description: Reads job priority factors from Slurm controller
Partition priority contributes to job priority

triggered_by.effect: New job appears with initial priority
AGE factor increases for waiting jobs

consistent_with.shared_state: Job IDs and queue order reflect priority
